descript.abstract: This theme shows the locations of wildfires for which the DNR was the primary responding agency. These include fires not only on state lands, but also rural private lands for which there is not another agency with primary responsibility. Wildfires that are not included in this theme are those that occur on federal and native American lands (several hundred annually) and those that are responded to by local fire departments (several thousand annually). DNR wildfire suppression responsibility is heaviest in the forested part of the state.
descript.purpose: Enables analysis of spatial and temporal patterns in wildfire starts.

timeperd.current: Time Period of Content date indicates the date which the user can be confident of accuracy and completeness of the dataset.

browse.browsed: The graphic is taken from the online interface to this dataset at http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/forestry/fire/maps/locations.html

dataqual.complete: Includes all fires reported by DNR field forestry offices.

horizpa.horizpar: Source layer pinmap: DNR field personnel report fire locations using PLS descriptors. The vast majority of fires are reported using a PLS forty descriptor, though occasionally a less precise PLS section descriptor may be used. Fire location points are assigned by taking the nominal center of the indicated PLS forty (section). Accordingly, fire locations can generally be considered to be accurate to within +-200 meters (1/8 mile), or +-800 meters (1/2 mile) in the rare instances where the fire location is reported using a PLS section descriptor.

procstep.procdesc: Attribute Lineage for source table EVNT_WFIREPT3.DBF: All attributes field-collected.

attracc.attraccr: Source table EVNT_WFIREPT3.DBF: Good - all data subjected to extensive validation checks at the time of data entry.

attr.attrdef: Unique ID, comprised of Year, Forestry RAN (a 3-digit administrative area identifier), and sequence number. Eg.: 20032410056
(Estimated) start date for this fire.
(Estimated) start time for this fire.
Number of forested acres burned.
Number of non-forested acres burned.
Total number of acres burned.
The name of the Minnesota county in which this fire occurred.
PLS section number. Valid values are 1-36.
Three-digit township (tier) number. 26 through 71, 101 through 168
Two-digit range number. 1 through 51
Range direction. "E" or "W"
Textual PLS forty identifier

attr.attrdef: Cause of this fire.
